New Records: 20-year-old Jackson Chourio was the youngest player to get two hits in his playoff debut
Key Match Events: Mark Vientos hit a tiebreaking, two-run single during a five-run outburst in the fifth inning
Jose Iglesias hit a hard grounder that first baseman Rhys Hoskins snared, but Iglesias dove headfirst and beat Payamps to the bag for an infield single
Brandon Nimmo reached on an infield single, Vientos hit a two-run single to right, and Martinez delivered a two-run single to right
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Carlos Mendoza said "I knew we were in a good spot when we boarded the plane. We celebrated. We got out of the clubhouse in Atlanta, and you could tell right away our mentality was next day, next game."
Post-Match Reflections: Mark Vientos said "It's hard to be tired when you're playing playoff baseball. I had a bunch of energy. I know all of us did. We were all excited, and we got the job done."

Luis Severino said "We're not satisfied. We know the potential that we have in that clubhouse, and we want to go out there, and we're going to fight. We're going to fight until the end, and hopefully that end is going to be hopefully win the World Series."
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets didn't earn a playoff berth until they rallied late from a three-run deficit to win the opening game of a makeup doubleheader in Atlanta on Monday
The Game 1 winner has gone on to advance in each of the eight series since Major League Baseball went to the current postseason format in 2022
Milwaukee has lost 10 of its last 11 playoff games, a stretch that began with its Game 7 home defeat against the Los Angeles Dodgers in the 2018 NL Championship Series
